title: (x) Boiler Room logo - Stencil {Nick Curtis}
content:
Usually, a font will look remotely familiar to me - this one is just baffling. I appreciate any attempts...

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [BoilerRoom.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130428000457/http:/typophile.com/files/BoilerRoom.jpg) | 13 KB |
author: burste

comments.content: Looks like plain ol' Stencil, set in caps and small caps, with a little (somewhat) inconsistent fiddling...

thanks for the input, but i believe this is a specific font. i don't believe the original designer had the ability to tweak the font. The kearning was left as is and it has a destinct distortion/erosion. Anyone else have any thoughts?

Combination boilers are probably the most common boiler type used in the UK at the moment. However, despite their popularity, many homeowners do not understand how they work. This article will answer some of the most common questions that are asked about combination boilers.

[Combination Boilers](http://web.archive.org/web/20130428000457/http:/www.plumbarena.co.uk/category/combi-boilers/)
